1) MKV files suck - when you convert them to DVD format the audio is usually out of sync with the video.
2) No DVD players can play MKV format.
3) Not everyone wants to watch a movie on their computer, especially if they have a 56" TV
4) Running a cable from your computer to your TV to play a movie is lame
5) There is a reason most movies are in avi format.

EXCELLENT DOWNLOAD , HQ HD , FAST and CLEAN , THANKS

I bought a wd hdtv live box that plays 1080p right out to the tv.  It plays damn near any format even shitty wmv files.  MKV works great on it, it's got two usb ports and ethernet.  Plug a usb hd into it and hook up the cat5 cable to the router and away I went.  I can stream to it, it does netflix, hulu and youtube too.  All for 99 dollars.  It's 2011 and I haven't burned a damn DVD in over a year except to give stuff to other people.  If you hate mkv then it's simple and free to convert it to avi if you must but really, it's not 1999 anymore.
THNX
